intro: Galipea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan galipea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
